includedAssets.title: The Godfather
includedAssets.synopsis: The Oscar-winning Marlon Brando stars as Don Corleone, the ageing patriarch of an organised crime dynasty who transfers control of his formidable empire to his reluctant son (Al Pacino). Francis Ford Coppola bagged Best Director and shared Best Screenplay with author Mario Puzo for turning his rather unremarkable source novel into a cinematic offering that nobody could refuse. Terrific performances and the perfect brooding atmosphere make it a truly outstanding work.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Francis Ford Coppola and Mario Puzo's Oscar-winning crime saga featuring an all-star cast including Marlon Brando and Al Pacino.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: The Oscar-winning Marlon Brando stars as Don Corleone, the ageing patriarch of an organised crime dynasty who transfers control of his formidable empire to his reluctant son (Al Pacino). Francis Ford Coppola bagged Best Director and shared Best Screenplay with author Mario Puzo for turning his rather unremarkable source novel into a cinematic offering that nobody could refuse. Terrific performances and the perfect brooding atmosphere make it a truly outstanding work.

includedAssets.title: The Godfather Part II
includedAssets.synopsis: Al Pacino and Robert De Niro take centre stage in Francis Ford Coppola's epic follow-up to his great adaptation of author Mario Puzo's legendary crime saga. While following in The Godfather's Oscar-winning footsteps, Part II looks forward and back in time, charting the rise of Vito Corleone (De Niro) from Sicilian underling to New York's all-powerful don. It also sees his initially noble son Michael (Pacino) develop an increasingly cruel streak to take over the family's criminal empire. Violent and serene by turns, it's cinema at its most satisfying.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Robert De Niro won his first Oscar as a young Don Corleone, with Al Pacino as his ruthless successor, in this mighty Mob epic.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: Al Pacino and Robert De Niro take centre stage in Francis Ford Coppola's epic follow-up to his great adaptation of author Mario Puzo's legendary crime saga. While following in The Godfather's Oscar-winning footsteps, Part II looks forward and back in time, charting the rise of Vito Corleone (De Niro) from Sicilian underling to New York's all-powerful don. It also sees his initially noble son Michael (Pacino) develop an increasingly cruel streak to take over the family's criminal empire. Violent and serene by turns, it's cinema at its most satisfying.

includedAssets.title: The Godfather Part III
includedAssets.synopsis: The concluding chapter of Francis Ford Coppola's grand gangster trilogy sees Al Pacino's ageing Michael Corleone now trying to put his criminal days behind him as a legitimate businessman. But just when he thought he was out, they pull him back in. Andy Garcia is a riveting new addition to the mob as Corleone's heir apparent, while Pacino revels in the last visit to the role that made him a star.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: The concluding chapter of Francis Ford Coppola's epic trilogy charts the final transition from criminality to legitimacy for the Corleone family.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: The concluding chapter of Francis Ford Coppola's grand gangster trilogy sees Al Pacino's ageing Michael Corleone now trying to put his criminal days behind him as a legitimate businessman. But just when he thought he was out, they pull him back in. Andy Garcia is a riveting new addition to the mob as Corleone's heir apparent, while Pacino revels in the last visit to the role that made him a star.

includedAssets.title: The Godfather Movie Box Set
includedAssets.synopsis: After his family is killed by a local Mafia boss, young Vito Corleone flees Sicily for America. He rises up to lead a powerful New York crime clan, before his reluctant war hero son, Michael, takes the reins and attempts to protect the business and legitimise the Corleone empire. Multi Oscar-winning classic from Francis Ford Coppola. Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Lee Strasberg, Andy Garcia and Diane Keaton star.
